post.content:
Hi Brendan,
Here is the job description.
The Programmer Analyst will be responsible for program code design, development and unit testing activities that support the project. This assignment will include the following:
1. Work with the Business and Systems Analysts to prepare detailed technical specifications and program code design documents as required.
2. Create object-oriented models in UML as design artefacts using tools such as Power Designer.
3. Provide assistance in preparation of the Test Plan for Unit and Integration testing.
4. Construct/enhance Java EE middle-tier systems using Java, EJB, JSP, Servlets, JDBC, JPA, XML (DOM, SAX, XSLT), DHTML/HTML, Web Service, WebLogic, Toplink, Oracle.
5. Prepare fully documented operational procedures for system and production system support staff as required.
6. Test the system to ensure requirements of the implementation are met.
7. Provide problem resolution support to database staff, system and user acceptance test teams, and other staff members.
8. Co-ordinate system development activities and technical consultative support to other staff members.
9. Provide knowledge transfer to ministry staff at all stages of this assignment.
10. Prepare unit test cases and perform unit testing.
11. Support systems and user testing.
12. Resolve defects as required.
13. Prepare implementation package.
14. Provide post implementation support.
Knowledge and Experience Requirements:
The candidate must be able to work in a multi-project, Multi-disciplinary enterprise environment seeking input and comment from other major initiatives.
Required Skills and Knowledge
The mandatory skills must include the requirements for the Programmer Analyst role level 2 as specified in the Task-based I&IT Consulting Services VOR 1019. Additional mandatory skills are as follow:
· Experience in development of N-tier applications, middleware and gateways.
· Knowledge of, and experienced with the following computing environments:
* Database: Oracle * Operating Platforms: Unix (Solaris), Windows (Server) * Web/Application Servers: WebLogic, Microsoft IIS
· Experience with Object Oriented Analysis & Design (UML – Use Case/Class Sequence/Collaboration/State)
· Experience in developing web-based applications using JEE (Java, EJB, JPA, JSP, Servlets, JDBC, JNDI), XML (DOM, SAX, XSLT), DHTML/HTML, Struts, Javascript, Web Services.
· Experience with Java EE Design Patterns.
· Working experience with toolsets that support object oriented languages and web application development including:
o Configuration/Builds: Harvest (or similar), Ant
o UML modeling tools
o Eclipse
o JUnit, Log4J
· Familiar with UI design principles and guidelines.
· Excellent problem solving, communication (verbal and written), and interpersonal skills.
· A team player with the ability to work with competing priorities and strict deadlines.
· Proven ability to perform to successful completion assignments of high magnitude and complexity.
Desirable Skills:
The desirable skills are:
· Object to Relational mapping: e.g. Toplink
· Power Designer
· IBM IMS Connect
· Knowledge of PKI
· Knowledge of emerging IT technologies and trends
Thank You,
